comments:
Build 20020418

Just for fun, I went to glance at the log, even though I had encountered no 
problems.  I had been debugging a target, but didn't notice anything unusual.
The .log had the following dumps:

There are two problems here
(1) We are attempting to resolve a variable after the thread resumes. We should 
detect that the thread resumed and return "null" (as the java doc states).
(2) We are looking for breakpoint text when a thread suspends, but the 
breakpoint has no underlying marker. (need to see if we are clearing 
breakpoints properly in the thread after they are hit).

Note that I had replaced some source projects with binary, so it's possible 
some breakpoint refs were no longer valid.

I was able to reproduce the missing marker problem by deleting a breakpoint 
while suspended at that breakpoint and then making the debug view refresh - it 
attempts to render the thread as suspended at a breakpoint that no longer 
exists.

Fixed - the target updates threads when a breakpoint is removed, removing the 
deleted breakpoint from threads "suspended breakpoint set".

traces.message: Breakpoint does not have an associated  marker.
Breakpoint does not have an associated  marker.
Breakpoint does not have an associated  marker.
